The father of star Celtics guard Jaylen Brown has been arrested for attempted murder, multiple outlets reported Thursday.
Quenton M. Brown, a former boxer who goes by his middle name Marselles, was booked into Clark County Detention Center on Thursday morning on suspicion of attempted murder, according to records viewed by The Post, in connection with a Las Vegas stabbing, NBC affiliate 3 News reported.
The alleged incident at All American Park unfolded in a parking space dispute over a “door ding,” with early reports indicating “the suspect stabbed the victim in the stomach,” per 3 News.
The suspect, who allegedly fled the scene, was taken into custody upon being located by police.
The victim, said to be a youth football coach, was transported to a hospital to undergo surgery, according to TMZ.
Doctors told Las Vegas police that the victim was in critical condition after suffering stab wounds to his back, clavicle and hands, while also breaking a rib.
The girlfriend of the victim claimed the couple was parked when an SUV pulled next to them and the passenger hit their car when he exited the vehicle.
After a verbal disagreement, Marselles followed the victim, per the girlfriend.
Brown “swung his arm in a straight stabbing motion and struck [the boyfriend] in his back,” the girlfriend said, according to police.
Another witness told cops they saw the accused swing his knife “25 times” at the victim, according to 3 News.
When police found Brown in the passenger seat of the car, he had abrasions to his knees and was bleeding from the face.
“He spontaneously uttered that this was all over a door ding without being asked any questions by Patrol officers,” the police report states.
Marselles is slated to appear in court Thursday.
He posted a 33-18-1 record as a boxer and made his debut in the sport in 1989.
Brown, an NBA champ with the Celtics and a four-time NBA All-Star, “doesn’t have a close relationship with his father and was unaware of the arrest or incident,” TMZ reported Thursday.
A first-round pick out of California in 2016, Brown has played for the Celtics during his entire nine-year NBA career.
The 28-year-old won his first NBA title in the 2023-24 season after the Celtics took down the Mavericks in five games.
Brown and the Celtics failed to defend their title this year after being knocked out of the Eastern Conference semifinals by the Knicks in six games.
He averaged 22.2 points per game, 5.8 rebounds and 4.5 assists during the regular season and tallied an average of 22.1 points, 7.1 rebounds and 3.9 assists in the postseason.

Julia Hill, a TikTokker with more than one million followers, said she was “so scared” after spending six hours in an Anaheim jail following her arrest for storming the field at an Angels-Reds game this week.
Hill, who goes by the name “mysteriousjulia” on social media, filmed herself running onto the field Monday night at Angel Stadium, where she was eventually handcuffed while on the ground and escorted out by a police officer and two security security guards.
In the video, Hill was seen filming herself and cheering as she sprinted across the outfield — before it cut to another angle of her being detained.
The video ends with Hill exiting the police station at 2:33 a.m.
“Guys, just got out of jail,” she says. “It’s like 2:23 a.m. I was in jail for, like, six hours. Honestly, I thought I was never coming out for a second. I was so scared.”
Hill captioned the video, “Intrusive thoughts got the better of me.”
Another TikTok video, set to the song “First Day Out” by rapper Tee Grizzley, shows Hill dancing outside of the police station after being released.
Someone in the comments asked, “Girl what were you thinking,” to which Hill replied, “Good question.”
The video of Hill invading the field had over a million likes as of Thursday morning.
Hill did not disclose if she was charged with any crime.

Tom Brady’s mini-me son Jack is not so mini anymore.
On Wednesday, the future Hall of Fame quarterback posted a collection of photos on Instagram from a recent golf outing at The Hills in East Quogue, N.Y. with his 17-year-old son, who towered over his 6-foot-4 father’s frame in one snap.
“Is Jack standing on something? Besides business lol,” Brady’s former Buccaneers teammate, wide receiver Mike Evans, wrote in the comments.
Rob Gronkowski, who played alongside the seven-time Super Bowl champion in New England and Tampa Bay, also teased, “Jack is way more beastly than you.”
Brady co-parents Jack with his ex-girlfriend, actress Bridget Moynahan. He is also a dad to son Benjamin, 15, and daughter Vivian, 12, whom he shares with ex-wife Gisele Bündchen.
The golf outing with his eldest son comes just as Brady, 47, is set to return to the booth for his second season as Fox’s lead NFL analyst.
He worked alongside play-by-play caller Kevin Burkhardt on the premier matchups of the 2024 season, including Super Bowl 2025 in New Orleans, where the Eagles throttled the Chiefs, 40-22.
Brady, who retired from the NFL in 2023 after 23 prolific seasons, reflected on his first year as a broadcaster in a candid Instagram post.
“It certainly was a new challenge to undertake but I couldn’t have asked for a better team to be a part of and learn from!” he wrote in February.
“To all of my @nflonfox teammates, producers, crew, and colleagues—you made this experience so special, and I’m grateful for the energy, dedication and perserverance you brought every week while always delivering the best broadcast for the fans who we serve week in and week out. It’s always been about the TEAM and I’m lucky to be part of this great one @foxsports.”
Brady officially joined Fox in May 2022 before his final season in the league.
He and Burkhardt will travel to Landover, Md. for Week 1 of the season when the Commanders host the Giants in an NFC East clash.
Fox’s top crew will travel to Kansas City the following week for a Super Bowl rematch as part of “America’s Game of the Week.”
